$Tejada left after fulfilling the minimum for a game played to keep his consecutive games played streak active; he suffered a distal radial fracture of the left wrist after being hit with a pitch the previous day; the streak is 1,152 counting this game and is the fifth longest in history and longest active streak

ej,frant001,M,knigb901,Second call reversal in game $ball was ruled foul by 3B umpire Brian Knight; SD Mgr Bud Black came out to argue; umpires huddled and changed call to home run; Boston Mgr Terry Francona talked with crew chief Dana DeMuth then yelled at Knight; Francona ejected by Knight

ej,welld001,P,hicke901,Balls and strikes $as Francoeur ran around the bases, Wells approached plate umpire Ed Hickox, arguing that the 2-2 and 3-2 pitches were strikes; Hickox turned away, Wells followed him and called him back; Hickox told him to get on the mound and then ejected him; Wells was restrained by manager Black and coach Hoffman, throwing the ball into the backstop as he left

$bloop down line, chased by left fielder and 3rd baseman, trailed by 3B umpire. Third base left open so pitcher Eaton ran to cover. As he arrived, 2B umpire Guccione charged over and flattened Eaton with an excellent block.  The runner, pitcher, and umpire lay in a heap for a few moments.

$Bradley stood at the plate for a while and then threw his bat down

$Cameron made a sliding attempt to catch the ball but missed; Bradley tried to jump over Cameron to avoid a collision; Bradley stepped on Cameron's right hand with his left foot; Cameron left with a with a bruised right thumb and index finger
$HP umpire Brian Runge asked Bradley if he threw his bat at the umpire; Bradley said no and asked if that was what 1B umpire Mike Winters told him; Runge said no and told Bradley to calm down

ej,bradm001,P,wintm901,Arguing about bat throwing incident $Bradley said something to umpire Mike Winters; during Kouzmanoff's at-bat, the conversation escalated into an argument; Padres manager Bud Black came out; Bradley went after Winters, was restrained by coach Bobby Meacham, then was ejected by Winters; Bradley continued to go after Winters; Black tired to restrain Bradley, grabbing him by the jersey and pushing him to the ground; Bradley grabbed his right knee and had to be helped off the field
